Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Neighborhood, Small Rooms, Near Subway”
Reviews.Author: triciabau
Reviews.Content: Overall Great Experience with this hotel. We found it from trip advisor, so we expected the small rooms. Reason for staying in this area was a chance to experience "living in a new york neighborhood" away from the Times Square hustle and bustle. Charming place and exactly what we hoped for. We felt very safe even if we got home late walking from the subway station. We were 4 friends vacationing. One set of friends were luckily enough to be upgraded to a suite so their room was very big, equivalent to small 2 rooms put together. I had no issues with the small room, as it was clean, the bed was firm and bathroom had hot water. 2 big luggages could fit in the room but left little space for walking around. Staff is friendly, able to recommend great restaurants in the area. Every morning there is free coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the small lobby. Very short walk to Central Park which had a weekend market with local vendors selling fresh vegetables, baked goodies (nice treat). Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: unahthefoodie
Reviews.Content: our flight was cancelled so we found this inexpensive apartment building turned into hotel via expedia at $89.00-night.so inexpensive considering the location was fabulous beyond belief,79th @Columbus in the Upper west Side.the room was small but we had a private bathroom.hot water took a bit to come up to temperature,no AC so would not be great in the heat of the summer.elevator was slow. But staff were very helpful and friendly.and really when your in NYC you just need a clean,comfortable place to lay your head and the 79 Park was what we needed.not great amenities but fab for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, overall OK”
Reviews.Author: NettaSL
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is ok, the room was clean and since we mostly were out (and didn't spend so much time there), I guess if you only need a place to sleep and located in a good area this hotel can work. I was a bit surprise from the very very small room and bathroom. Sometimes it took like 5 min till the hot water in the shower started to flow, and in our room we didn't have AC- so if you are going to stay there when its hot you should check the AC matter.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best in winter”
Reviews.Author: Melvillean
Reviews.Content: Park 79 is in a great Upper West Side location, close to public transportation, museums and other sites, and an endless variety of good restaurants. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are small and basic, but clean. My only complaint is that there's no air conditioning; it's 70 degrees today and my fifth-floor room is very warm. I can't even imagine how warm it must be in the summer heat.

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of renovations!”
Reviews.Author: JanMann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, and the price is also very reasonable by NYC standards, however........ My friend and I were given a first floor room (suite) with a small bedroom and sitting room with pull -out bed. This situation was fine even with the small bathroom, as we were out and about all day long and into the evening. Sleeping was really impossible though..... The old building was heated with steam heat and the transfer pipe for the entire building ran up the wall in our bedroom. It was December and chilly, so the old pipes literally clanked the entire night ( and I mean it sounded like someone was banging on the pipe with a sledge hammer.) The hallways are also very noisy (wood floors echo any walking and talking done in the halls) We called the front desk at 3:30 am to complain about the yelling going on just outside of our doorway ( there was nothing that they could do about the clanking pipes, but they did ask the group of five or six men to leave the hallway) I will say, at checkout the Manager was very nice and apologetic and refunded us one nights stay. This could be a great hotel with a few renovations... It has charm and potential, and the staff was very accommodating, in light of the fact that they must apologize constantly for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE - YOU CAN FIND 1 MILLION % BETTER FOR SAME PRICE JUST AROUND THE CORNER!”
Reviews.Author: SS4911
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute rip off for what it is. Firstly I would like to say that this is not a hotel, it is more like a HOSTEL. Here are the points that drove me up the wall: 1) no hot water. 2) cockroaches in the drawer! I am NOT kidding 3) the doors to the rooms MUST be made of thin paper as in the middle of the night, when someone would walk past, you could here everything they were saying and I woke up every single time. 4) the lift is sooooo slow. 5) hotel lobby receptionist - there was a man working on the reception who was the rudest person I have ever come across. The booking was made under a friend of mine's name and the guy would not let me check in unless I was that person!!! unbelievable - I have stayed at 5 star hotels all over the world and never ever had such a problem and here in this hostel like "hotel" he was giving me a hard time!!!! I went for a walk up to West 81st Street and found a STUNNING hotel for exactly the same price. it was only maybe a 3 star hotel but I promise you, the furnishings, the bathrooms, everything looked like 5* - It was called Excelsior - It was so much better, soooooooo much better. PLEASE DON'T BE FOOLED BY WHAT THIS PLACE LOOKS LIKE FROM THE OUTSIDE. IT IS HORRRRRRRRRRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms fantastic! Ours was not!”
Reviews.Author: verycriticaltraveler
Reviews.Content: So this is a great hotel for the location and price in NEW YORK CITY!!! But perhaps you shouldn't take the cheap route as we did getting a room with a shared bath for about $100 a night. This room was on the 7th floor and the elevator in this building is SO slow! Also, it takes forever for the hot water to reach the showers and sinks in the bathrooms. The shared bathrooms are nice and spacious and always available, but the water is an issue. Now, our family members had a room with a bath on the 3rd floor for about $20 more a night. That room was excellent. Much larger than ours and in the back of the hotel so there wasn't any street noise from 79th. It was room 315. I would use this hotel again, but choose more wisely and spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: smilenyc
Reviews.Content: We stay here every time we are in NYC and we go once a year. This time was no exception...we had a great experience. Our first room was on the 8th floor and we asked if we could be on the first (save time and energy). They didn't have any trouble moving us and it was the second time we stayed in that room. It was like coming home. Thanks Park 79 for another great visit. We will be back and thanks for the chocolates. They hit the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: cryskeys
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the great location and price of this hotel. That is until I actually saw the size of the room. It is actually pretty funny looking back on it. The room was literally smaller than my college dorm room. I do not remember reading anywhere that the bathrooms were community bathrooms. That being said the bathrooms were very clean considering. The rooms were very clean and flat screen TV was a plus. Here are the pros: great location, nice staff, clean room. Here are the cons: rooms are very small, you can hear everything in the halls, community bathroom. If you do not mind these things than this hotel is great considering the price!

Reviews.Title: “A real Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Jopin55
Reviews.Content: If you can do without the gym and use Central park for recreation, you are in for a treat. You pay 100 Bakaroos for the night and get what in NY is considered a Junior suite. Look I lived in Manhattan for 5 years. There are ZERO hotels in the city as good as this one. FREE internet, nice staff, restaurants everywhere (you are in Manhattan, so it's true for anywhere in the city). Right across you have a laudry so you can drop off your clothes and get them back for 10 dollars, washed and folded. How's that for service. Just don't use the Italian place around the corner on Amsterdam called "Al Dente". They are Indiands and don't know the difference between Spaghetti and Spagettini. The problem with Park 79 is that fills up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago213
Reviews.Content: So we checked into this hotel first going into the elevator which was the size of a small closet barely fiitting 2 people. We went up to our room where the floor stunk like an old indian kitchen, going into the room was a very small sized place with 2 twin beds. The bathroom was also size of a closet and the bed sheets had stains. As soon as we checked in we knew we didnt feel comfortable staying there so we asked expedia if they can change our hotel. The hotel declined to give us the refund and did not care at all. We checked out early, let them keep the money and we went to another hotel. Hilton in Times square, it was 10000 times better. Dont stay here unless you want to be far from the strip and feel disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Ron C
Reviews.Content: I must preface this review by saying I did not stay at the hotel, but I did work with the staff. My experience dealing with Blake Augustus, manager of the hotel, was nothing short of amazing. I shipped a package to a guest at the hotel and there were issues with getting it delivered. Blake went far beyond the call of duty to make it happen. She sent the bellman to track down the UPS driver on 2 occasions, he was successful on the final try. Without going into details there were more problems once the package was on site as the driver would not release it. Not once did she waiver from making sure the guest was getting that package and she did it with class and professional behavior. I cannot remember the last time I was as impressed with the level of service I received. I wish more businesses would pay as much attention to detail and service like Blake does. We would all benefit from it. Thanks again Blake.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced Hotel in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Debra680
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel in January 2012 for a post-cruise vacation. It was conveniently located near the subway and lots of restaurants two blocks south. The rooms were tiny, but clean, flat screen TV, new bathroom. The parking was 3 blocks away and $32/night, so that was a negative. Located in a fairly nice part of the city and had reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth m
Reviews.Content: Do you think the days of excellent customer service have gone by and are forgotten? Not so at The Park 79. We have not yet arrived and the staff has gone out of their way to help us with our accomodations. The manager, Blake Augustus, helped us personally with a obstacle we encountered in our travel plans and our comfort level was her goal. We would not get better service at a five star, this I am certain. I look forward to our stay with them and will write a glowing review after our stay, I am sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice little hotel. Miniscule dark bathroom”
Reviews.Author: jlbtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Park 79 just before Christmas. I booked this property based on a number of good Trip Advisor reviews as well as the price. Overall, the hotel is in a really good location - not far from the subway, Zabar's and the Natural History Museum and a couple of good restaurants around the corner. Great little convenience store right across the street. Check-in was fine, hotel staff is very nice, no problems and Hotel was fully booked during our stay. Rooms are pretty small (we had a twin bed room on the 6th floor) which was clean and for the most part pretty quiet....with the exception of one night: A couple with one or 2 very young children were entering their room at 3am and were extremely loud ---- kids yelling and running up and down the hallway, which are not carpeted so there is a loud echo. I mentioned it to the front desk the next morning and she was very apologetic and said if it happened again to notify them immediately. Fortunately there was no further need. The bathrooms have been recently remodeled and are lovely but extremely European in that they are extremely small, narrow and dark.Whoever decided to use wall to wall, floor to ceiling dark brown tiles must be kidding. The lighting is very poor too. I am 5'2" and frequently banged my head on the towel rack and had trouble closing the shower door. Shower is miniscule - don't drop the soap as there is no way to pick it up without getting out of the shower. Perhaps because they were so full, but our room was never made up until after 3 or 4 pm each day and we had to keep asking for towels --- they would take the dirty ones but forget to give us clean ones. I was able to catch the maid in the hallway on 2 occasions and she was very friendly and sweet. If you're there for just a night or two and want a clean, safe hotel in a nice location at a decent price the Park 79 is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Park 79 Hotel, New York City”
Reviews.Author: MarkBergin
Reviews.Content: Park 79 Hotel on West 79th Street on Manhattan's Upper West Side is a gem. Apparently an old mansion converted to a hotel, the prices are very reasonable for New York City. Stayed in a suite, so didn't have to share a washroom. Small, but for New York, big room. Flat screen TV in bedroom and living room (living room had pullout couch), free wifi Internet. A safe in the room was a nice addition for storing our passports and netbooks, etc. Also, a small fridge and microwave meant we could have breakfast and late night snacks in the hotel. It's in a great location, a half block from the Museum of Natural History, and a block further from Central Park. Subway lines one and two blocks away. Great shopping, restaurants, small grocery shops nearby. Liked it so much, we've already stayed there twice. Will go back again ASAP. Staff was friendly and helpful, including printing something from my computer (ticket to get into Top of Rock). If you want twice the size and half the price and a quiet neighborhood compared to the Times Square area, check out Park 79 Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great”
Reviews.Author: Chiefopd
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel in our trips to NYC for over 4 years. The rooms are small, but I don't go to the City to hang out in a hotel room. They have always been clean and comfortable. They staff is friendly and willing to take care of your needs. It is located a half a block from the Natural History Museum in a very nice neighborhood. We feel very comfortable walking about at night. There are some great restaurants and ready access to two N/S subway lines. And the best part it that the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: lucille w
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a disappointment . My closet is bigger than the room. Took forever to get hot water for a shower and there was no way to regulate the heat. We faced 79th street and it was so noisy. Couldn't tell whether it was the noise of the heat coming up, the noise of traffic or the noise of the other guests going in and out of the communal bathrooms all night. I did not get a wink of sleep all night. Sorry i picked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely tiny; dirty; no control of temperature”
Reviews.Author: AggieAuthor
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location near Central Park. I just got back from the hotel. Here's the problem: guests have no way to control the temperature in their room. The first night we were there, the NYC air was unseasonably warm. Being from the south, we like our air conditioning. There was not only no air, but the furnace would not turn off. We called the desk and they said it is centrally controlled--- nothing we could do to turn it off. Finally, about 2am, my son and I were sweat down in our bed and we each had a massive headache, so we searched for a way to open the window. After much effort, we got it open, but then the rest of the night we could hear all the street noise, and I ended up sitting up to protect my son in case someone tried to come through the window. A truly miserable night. The hallways are dirty, and there were stains on my sheets. I was so grossed out that I slept in all my clothes and laid a layer of towels over the sheets. I am not particularly a clean freak-- just a normal person-- so if you happen to be a little on the OCD side, you would flip out. We had intened to stay for a week, but checked out after two nights (because we had to give 24 hours notice) and checked into the Hotel Edison in Times Square, which was incredible. We paid the same for each of the two rooms. By comparison, the hotel Edison was a suite with a seperate sitting area and a pullout sofa. Plus it was walking distance to Times Square. The only thing Park 79 has going for it is being near Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet, and clean”
Reviews.Author: sojourner1208
Reviews.Content: Double room with bath was clean, comfortable and quiet. I asked for a room towards the back of the hotel because I read tripadvisor reviews that said they were quieter. They had coffee downstairs which they didn’t take up till Noon so I enjoyed two free cups of it daily before going out. Excellent location a short walk to Amsterdam Avenue with many moderately priced restaurants and about ¼ block from Columbus Avenue where you can catch the M7 bus to Columbus Circle and connect with several busses and subway routes. The Natural History Museum about ¼ block East and Central Park about 2 blocks East. A convenience store open till midnight and laundry across the street and Deli around the corner on Columbus Avenue. You can catch the #79 bus to take you to 5th Ave just south of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Staff was professional and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: LouiseBrereton
Reviews.Content: Would recommend-not in midtown New York eg times square/shops etc but this doesn't matter as it's right opposite central park and a lovely 20-30 min walk downtown (otherwise a taxi about 8-10 dollars). We had great weather so walking fine otherwise think about the costs. Hotel itself clean and fresh towels/bed made up everyday. Shared bathroom was clean and no probs as it was always vacant although we did shower 730am everyday-any later it may be busier.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday trip to new york”
Reviews.Author: 3wheelsmad
Reviews.Content: never been to new york before did this off the internet...and had a great time lovely room but shared bathroom but it wasnt a problem we would stay there again lovely and quiet and central park a stones throw away

Reviews.Title: “So New York City, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn G
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Park 79 over the Thanksgiving holiday in the Jr. Suite on the 5th floor. We loved the ambiance from the outside of the building with its blue awning and flower pots, to the arch doorway in the suite. It was New York City apartment style. Not too fancy, but just what we were looking for. Very comfortable and the location was just fantastic. Near central park where my 7 year old loved the playgrounds. My teenage son enjoyed the close subway system and the deli and pizza on Amstersdam.....yum! Coming from California, the feel of this hotel on the upper west side was perfect. The lobby had hot cocoa and tea in the morning and Godiva chocolate pearls when we checked in made it unique. The smaller bathroom and elevators were expected in a hotel in New York. The achitecture of the building with the beautiful tiled floors from a era gone by....what can I say. Give this place a try, Like Frank Sinatra sang, "Its up to you New York, New York." Don't sit in the room use the location to enjoy oneself.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: d27pat
Reviews.Content: We're native New Yorkers born and bred (live in Queens) and we had a late night concert at Lincoln Center on November 29th and wanted to stay the night in Manhattan so we chose Park 79. We are glad we did--it's a lovely building from the outside (I love the upper West Side- the architecture, the restaurants, the ambience, everything. If I lived in Manhattan, this is where I would live) the lobby was dazzling (they were just decorating the Christmas tree) the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and quiet (be sure to get the back of the building, 79th St is busy), they have AM coffee service in the lobby and you get plenty of soaps, lotions, etc. I laugh when people complain that the bathroom is small--hello, it's a bathroom. Get out and see the city. Definitely would stay again--

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable hotel in Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: mammycat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great - sparkling clean, comfortable, very quiet - we couldn't hear neighbouring TV's even - and a great location. The staff was helpful and friendly - it's a bargain by NYC hotel standards. We would definitely stay there again. The area has lots of good places to eat and is close to subways, Central Park, the Museum of Natural History & the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite on the seventh floor for abour $850 for three nights--not bad split between two people. I think I received hot water for a shower once. The main bed was hard like a plank; the sofa-bed was actually much more comfortable--which should tell you something. The bathroom is indeed tiny. That would have been OK except that, bizarrely, the shower has dark black tiles all around it and there is no light in the shower. (So why didn't they go with light tiles?) Also, the wash basin is in a small alcove near the door. The plus of this place is location. Close to Central Park (two blocks away), the Natural History Museum (a half-block) and in a very nice residential area with plenty of restaurants and subways stops in both directions (west or east). But it is very old and tiny. The tiny would have been OK had it really been properly restored. It hasn't been. It had the feel of a place where the minimum had been done to get it above hostel status--which is nor far off what it is. While people say, "But it's New York-who stays in the room?"--most everyone does after a day of walking. And it doesn't have the comfortable feeling of a place you could relax in late afternoon and read a book before you go out again in the evening. It has a dingy dark feel. The staff were pleasant enough. (I didn't bother to complain--what were they going to do about inadequate pluming that doesn't deliver hot water?) But I wouldn't stay here again. If someone is on a tight budget, sure. But looking back on it, I would have opted to spend an extra couple of hundred bucks over three nights and got a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service”
Reviews.Author: kbjellerup
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in Feb 2011 in the Internet suite where everything was ok, maybe the double sofa bed could benefit from a new one. Really nice staff and excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Affordable hotel , in a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Jillyallen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a the Upper West Side, right next door the the Natural History Museum, a 5 minute walk in either direction to the subways ( Line 1 and Line A ) . The area is nice and safe with lots of eating places , bars and Starbucks nearby , The hotel offers free coffee/tea in the morning and it has free internet. The room was perfectly adequate for my stay , yes , the rooms and bathrooms are small (would only be a problem if you are FAT, then you might struggle with the bathroom.) but hey , if you are in NY , the only time you should be in your room is to sleep!! I found the staff friendly and helpful , particularly the night staff. I was happy with my stay here and the price I paid for a hotel in Manhattan, a city in which hotel rooms can be very expensive

Reviews.Title: “better places for the money”
Reviews.Author: malibuwanderlust
Reviews.Content: This hotel was tired, dirty from the lobby to the interior halls,clue number one. It did not even have basics.... like a plastic bag for your laundry or a door hanger for the outside of your door for privacy,clue number two. The "property manager" Blake assured me I would have a newly remodeled room when I booked by phone, it was dark,cheap furnishings,tacky old pillows and blanket most likely from a Goodwill store down the street,it surely was not even remotely close to what is on the website, know the visuals are misleading. I left two messages for Blake and of course she never returned the call.Furthermore, I had to pay upfront for all 4 nights when($300 per night) I checked in before I saw my room, when I indicated that I wanted a better room upon seeing it, of course they were all booked up. They had me and knew it as I had already paid upfront after a long,tiring flight.The only thing I can say that was good about my experience was the location.The staff and hotel were a disapointment to say the least and will never recommend anyone for 79 Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not bother”
Reviews.Author: MDowg
Reviews.Content: Rooms & bathroom are way too small, noisy inside & out, power points don't work, heater makes loud noises during the night, shower looks dirty & takes ages to warm up etc etc etc....not worth what you pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt do it again”
Reviews.Author: spyonline
Reviews.Content: Pros - Great location and price $$. Cons - Room was TINY compared to other small NYC hotel rooms. Bathroom was also so TINY, you had to maneuver around the sink to sit on the toliet. I think my a@@ hit every wall trying to do this. All dark gray tile in bathroom made it so so dark. I think this was done to hide the dirt. I mean this room was so tiny that a 19" flat screen was too big. I would not stay here again there are so many other hotels within the same price range that have much more room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: goldplatinumetc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 nights. They upgraded my queen superior to king superior to check me in sooner. Good sized room, clean, on the north end so I had a great view. Only thing missing was shower cap. Comfy towels. Good bed. Pretty spacious for New York at that price range. Very friendly desk help. I'd stay here again. One problem was water pressure fluctuated on the sixth floor where I was, but it would always come back up if I waited. Plenty of hot water. Elevator was small, but not as slow or problematic as others have written. Never waited more than 3 or 4 minutes max.

Reviews.Title: “Great, small hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: MRBWashingtonDCarea
Reviews.Content: We chose Park79 for its quiet location and good price for a long weekend in NYC. Yes, the room was small, but it's New York; small is fine. It was clean, comfortable and served our needs very well as we were out and about all day. While our bathroom was very small, it did the job. Staff were terrific and always very nice. We'd definitely choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location.”
Reviews.Author: missellestryke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while in NYC the end of September 2011. We absolutely loved it. Small but charming. Great service. Awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “professional staff and very quiet location.very happy with it”
Reviews.Author: mapiliPalermo
Reviews.Content: i was satisfied with choosing Park 79.Staff were kind,efficient and helpful,It struck me that they changed the air conditioning device without me even asking for it.It was dripping in the morning.When i returned to the hotel by 6 p.m. they had replaced it.The room was cleaned up every morning,sheets changed every other day,bathroom small but very well equipped and towels were high quality.Quiet location,very good sleep.and complimentary coffee every morning.I would have no hesitation to go back there as a guest.I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Caldwellbelle
Reviews.Content: Be careful when booking , some of the rooms in this hotel share a bathroom with other guests. We booked a room with two single beds and did not share a bathroom. The room was small the bathroom even smaller,but typical of New York. We stayed on the fifth floor, unfortuately we were next door to a shared bathroom and the noise at night kept us awake. The room was clean and maid service good. Door man great , woman behind the desk rude. Very safe neighborhood to walk around even at night. Subway 2 blocks away. Taxi to Time Square ten dollars. No vending machines, but convenience store across the street. 2 blocks to the Shake Shack great hamburgers and frozen custard. Quick check in.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Greensleeves
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for the price paid. In brief, I would use it again if I could not afford better.Not a good start when we arrived and found mix up in room booking. Room reserved not available until second night. This meant packing and unpacking again. In fairness, Hotel very apologetic and did not charge us for the first night,which was appreciated. Staff very helpful and rooms clean and adequate. Bathrooms very small and poky. Location was excellent,near bus and subway stops ,bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick!”
Reviews.Author: eharm
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect (upper West side - 1 blocks from Museum of Natural History & 2 blocks from Central Park). The staff were helpful enough, and check in was quick and painless. The room was small, and the bathroom was tiny - but it did the trick! We spent all of our time out enjoying the city and therefore didn't require anything special! But it was clean! It was also in an area surrounded by amazing restaurants, and it was only 2 blocks from the closest subway line! Great deal for the price! No complaints (and complimentary coffee each morning!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but 3rd rate”
Reviews.Author: jayh-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was a bit less costly than many other area hotels. The room was big enough and the hotel isn't a fleabag place...its tolerable but don't expect the Ritz Carlton. Finishes are banged up and worn and there isn't too much care that goes into the place. When the lobby furniture is stained and threadbare it tells you something about the management. You wonder what might be lurking in the carpet and the mattress. For a little more you can stay at the Excelsior on 81st bet CPW and Columbus...its much better.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian at best”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa00
Reviews.Content: Park 79 is basically a roof over your head in a location close to Central Park. We found the service completely indifferent, which we interpreted as unwelcoming. In fact, I left with the room key card in my pocket later in the day after checking out, which reminded me that we paid upfront and nobody thanked us for staying in the hotel when we left. We just walked out the door. We slept well; bedding was comfortable and there was little street noise. The room itself was tiny and the bathroom was worse - claustrophobic. Note to proprietors: if you don't have a lighting in a darkly tiled shower, you feel like you are showering in a coffin. Considering the many options available in NYC, I would not stay here again nor recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice low cost Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevefog
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of its low cost and proximity to Downtown Manhattan. I was not disappointed. I had a single room which whilst small met all my needs, because of the shared bathrooms there could be a slight delay if you needed them but this was the only downside. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful especially Monica at the reception desk. The rooms were kept tidy, well cleaned and stocked with the necessary towels and courtesy wash items. The hotel was a 5 minute walk from the subway which led to a 10 minute journey to Times Square. I recommend this hotel and should I go to NYC again I will most definitely use it again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but Juniorsuites are very tiny”
Reviews.Author: db2ernst
Reviews.Content: The location of Park 79 Hotel is great, and very convenient to several subways. Our Junior suite didn't quite live up to our expectations, as the 2 rooms were very small. 1st night we had to sleep in 2 double rooms, due to overbooking - and they were reasonable sized.

Reviews.Title: “Park Yourself Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: hain007
Reviews.Content: Location is the best feature of this hotel provided you want to be in a neighborhood setting as opposed to Mid-town location. We have stayed all over the City so this is not our first rodeo but, by far, our worst experience. The biggest flaw with this hotel is the terrible management and absence of leadership when there are legitimate problems present. I encountered guests complaining at the front desk 4 out of the 6 days in which we stayed at this hotel. The desk clerks handle problems without guidance or direction from management -- or perhaps just incompetent and indifferent management decisions. Staff are left to deal with the frustrated (and sometimes angry) guests while the manager hides out in an "office" somewhere out of sight. The result is a woeful attempt at service that is lackluster at best and incompetent at worst. It is too bad because this hotel has great potential to be a real gem in the City. THE PROBLEM: Our first evening in NY we returned to our room at 11pm to find the a/c broken and leaking water all over our bed, my luggage and the floor. Throughout the remainder of the night, I was soaking up water with towels (15 towels in all) and alternately shutting off the unit to reset the thermostat. The front desk clerk explained there was nothing he could do until morning---not great news, but understandable given the late hour. The issue is that my husband has a heart condition that is adversely affected by heat and we needed to have a cooler room for him. I spent a good deal of the late evening (or I should say, wee morning hours) calling other hotels trying to locate another room for the evening while also attempting to keep the air conditioner running without leaking water all over the room. The front staff did not offer any suggestions for other hotels, a phone book or even a courtesy phone call (since my cell phone did not work in our room --- all calls were made by me in the front lobby). At approx 2am, the front desk contacted me to say they had a room available due to a late cancellation. It was a single, but I could move my husband to the room while I stayed with the children in our sauna suite. Turns out the room was offered to me for the evening; however, they would charge for my current room, which was already a higher suite rate, and also for the additional room at that posted rate of 170.00. I could hardly believe my ears! To have a room available and not offer it at no charge is unbelievably discourteous -- particularly in view of the health issue involved for my husband. In addition, the next morning, the housemaid told me I would have to pay extra laundry fees for the towels used to soak up the a/c leak. Unbelievable! Three attempts to speak with the manager resulted in these comments: "you just missed her" -- "she just left the building" --- "she just went into a meeting." The final offer of compensation was to remove the tax for one night's stay...a grand total of less than $20 --- which, by the way, I have yet to receive. It may be that if nothing whatsoever unusual happens during your stay, you will be fine. However, if you have any issue crop up....you will live to regret this stay. Personally, I will not risk a stay here again, EVER!

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie B
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had the worst experience at this hotel. The service was apalling and the room was not even close to as depicted on all the adverts. My fiance ended up with bug bites. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for the money”
Reviews.Author: keywestnan
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet little hotel in a terrific location -- the Upper West Side, right near Central Park, the Natural History museum and two subway lines. The room was clean and larger than I expected, the staff was helpful and courteous. Our room was next to the lobby, facing the street, and I never noticed noise at all. It was quite warm but the room AC was effective. Hard to imagine better value for the money in this neighborhood. Our friends, who were traveling with their kids, stayed in a suite with a foldout couch and they were also thrilled with the accomodations. Highly recommended as long as you're not expecting luxury amenities. My only quibble would be a dearth of outlets since we all have so many gadgets to charge these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Famtraveller89
Reviews.Content: Only positive things to say about our three-night stay at the Park 79. The building has a quirky charm, with interestingly shaped corridors and high ceilings, and the staff were extremely helpful and efficient. As for other reviews talking about dingy, tiny rooms...this is NYC after all, right? and if you want your sheets changed every day, try the Waldorf Astoria. We were a family of five in a suite and were very comfortable. We had friends in two other rooms and we were all delighted and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient & reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: milepat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small & bathroom oh do tiny but the shower wad clean & comfy. Clean environment friendly staff. Conviniently located. Convenience store across the street. Very few restaurants very close bit some good ones within walk distance. Find your own car parking close by. Quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: readingqueen914
Reviews.Content: PArk 79 was a cute and sweet hotel on Manhattan's upper west side, it is about 2 blocks from the closest subway and close to small markets and delis. it is a stones throw from central park and not far from other famous new york attractions. it was quiet, clean, and had great customer service. i will stay here again on my next trip to the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet hotel on the upper west side”
Reviews.Author: KingAnge
Reviews.Content: This very clean, small hotel is on a quiet street with a large variety of shops, restaurants, groceries, and transportation (bus as well as subway) in a two to three block area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but really dingy hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinabm
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Park 79 Hotel and will definitely be my last. The price for a 2 room suite big enough for the 4 of us was a real bargain for the location and now I know why. The room(s) were small, dingy, stuffy and in somewhat a state of disrepair. There was a window a/c that kept one room freezing cold, but the other room was stuffy and hot. All in all, not a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TripsyMidlands
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably easy to find and is located in the upper west area of New York. The hotel is near Central Park and the Museum of Natural History and Planetarium. There are also some nice places near by for breakfast etc. The hotel service is fairly good but the rooms are very basic with a very small en-suite ie not enough room to get out of the shower cubicle unless you are thin! It does serve its purpose and has a big screen TV and air-con. I can't really complain as it has the necessities to suit most people's budget in this city. One down side is that although there is free wifi included, we did find that it did not always work.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value, great positioning”
Reviews.Author: duffduffmcduff
Reviews.Content: Exactly what we wanted, and as we're students travelling the price was great as well. One block from Central Park and a stones throw away from the Subway station. Really nice rooms, clean and no hassle. Escalator was a bit 'retro', but other than that it was brilliant! Would reccommend it to anyone staying in New York.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT--adorable and the best neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: TeacherGirl80
Reviews.Content: The best bang for your buck. My husband and I stayed at Park 79 for our first trip to NYC and we couldn't have found a better hotel. It was adorable, clean, and quaint. I loved how it was far away from the touristy spot (aka Times Square-yuck!), and instead it was in a neighborhood that was safe, clean, and just charming. The Upper West Side is also where a lot of movies and TV shows have been filmed, so it's truly the real NY experience. It's close to the famous Zabars gourmet market, Central Park, museums, and subway stations. It was such a good location, we raved about our luck in finding this place all week long. The hotel reminded us of buildings in San Francisco with the hardwood floors, small elevator, and trim on ceilings. This was truly a NY gem of a hotel, the real deal, not touristy, more of a European feel. Know this about us: we are very picky, but not snobby--I am especially particular about hotel cleanliness, linens, and towels, but this place really met all of our expectations. The staff was friendly and they always greet you when you walk in the lobby, ask about your sightseeing day, etc. My husband and I went for four days together to do sightseeing, but then he left and I stayed for five more days to attend a teacher convention at Columbia Teacher's College, so I stayed a total of 10 days. That is a pretty long hotel stay, but I was pleased the whole way through. We already know when we go back, we're going back to Park 79 in the Upper West Side, we couldn't have been happier. As they say, Location, Location, Location!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for school kids' tour.”
Reviews.Author: super_summilux
Reviews.Content: A budget hotel which reminds you of the lodges where you stayed at summer schools. Reasonably priced, but you eventually pay the price of cutting the cost by the small rooms, odd layout, and for some folks who booked the studio, the shared toilet and bathroom (my room with no toilet or bath was $140). Of course the hotel clearly reminds you that the cheapest option (studio) "might" be a room with shared bathroom so this is nothing to be complained. I'd say this is a choice when you're looking for a budget hotel in upper Manhattan to lodge a soccer team, but not recommended for family or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, inexpensive, and in the best neighborhood in the city!”
Reviews.Author: e.b.white
Reviews.Content: In my favorite part of the city! Safe and beautiful in the upper west side. Just a block from Central Park, close to the subway, and restaurants and coffee shops. Across the street from the Natural History Museum. I had always stayed at the Excelsior Hotel down the block, (My favorite hotel!) but I needed something less expensive on this trip. I was with my seven-year-old daughter and my mother. This hotel was perfect. It had very comfortable linens, and coffee in the lobby. We paid $159 per night for the three of us, which is a good deal in a very expensive city. Okay, the room was very small. And the bathroom was very small. And we had a view of a brick wall. But, If you don't need a large room, and you want to stay in the upper west side, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “July 2011 NYC Trip”
Reviews.Author: I_am_a_magpie
Reviews.Content: Been to the city several times but always stayed in Jersey. Chose this hotel for location and price. Stayed 7/1/11 - 7/5/11. Average price per night only $139. Hotel is in a lovely neighborhood right behind the Museum of Natural History. Walking distance to subway line 1 (on Broadway & 79th) and lines C or B next to the museum. Room was big enough and the closet had 14 hangers (I traveled w/ my aunt. 2 girls...need lots of hangers for clothes) :) The bathroom is small but clean. Fresh, clean, big towels provided every day. Ironing board and iron are provided (in the closet). Beds were comfy. We stayed in room 610 and never had any issues with noise from other rooms or outside. Neighborhood has lots of shops, delis, etc. Felt completely safe walking back to the hotel even at 2:00am. Will definitely be staying in this hotel again. Can't beat the price or location!!! (NOTE: Not ideal for business travelers necessarily or travelers that may spend a lot of time in their room. More for travelers that plan on being out and about and just want to come back to a clean, nice hotel that has friendly service).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price range - top location”
Reviews.Author: happycamper014
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with 2 kids ( 8 and 3) and booked a suite for 3 nights. We were on the ground floor at the rear of the building. We had no issues at all with noise and slept well. The kids slept on the sofa bed - it was cramped when the sofabed was extended. The staff were great with the kids and even gave them some chocolate when we arrived which put everyone in a good mood. I booked online and due to a change in our dates, dealt with Monica who really was excellent online and in person. This is an old style hotel and is not flashy but it is clean and well run. Frankly, the location was so good and because of the warm weather we were out and about all day and then out for dinner ( great options nearby) that we did not spend a lot of time in the room. The proximity to Central Park and the Museum of Natural History ( out the door and across the road) was perfect for us and the kids loved walking around the area and checking out the local toy shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: grandduchess
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel room for two nights in Manhattan and I chose the Park 79 mostly for the location, but also for the price. I was not disappointed. I had reserved a double bed with a shared bath. I checked in early and they didn't have that room ready, but offered me a single bed for a worthwhile cost savings (far more than the online difference had been). I accepted. The room was clean and perfect for me. I never had an issue with sharing the bathroom. There were two on my floor and one was always available. There were no issues with hot water or water pressure. I did, however, experience a palmetto-type bug. But Housekeeping took care of it and there was never another. (That's why they get 3 stars though and not four.) The coffee in the lobby in the morning was delicious. The staff were friendly. The AC worked well. The room was fairly quiet as well. The wireless internet was fine. The only real problem was the lack of available electrical outlets. The only one I could access was by the sink. It would have been nice if there were another one available. Most travelers these days need to plug in phone, computer and ipod. The location is excellent, close to subways, museums, restaurants, Central Park. I will definitely stay here again! But next time I'm bringing a power strip.

Reviews.Title: “CRAMPED”
Reviews.Author: kma6k
Reviews.Content: I would guess that the room I stayed in was about 8" X 12" or so, not much more than that. Very small. The bed was so old I could feel the springs digging into my back. The TV didn't work quite right, the shower pressure was low, and I could hear doors slamming in the hallway all night. In short, not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service :)”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen1987
Reviews.Content: I bought my mother to new york as a xmas and birthday present and we chose to stay here at Park 79 after hours of searching for a hotel and i am really glad we did, the presetation of the hotel was brilliant and the service we recieved for all our stay was amazing. the lift was slow but i we werent bothered the bathroom was seperate from the room but it was only like a door or two down and yet doesnt bother me, the room was a good size and had a tv, sink basin etc and basic but i dont need much from a room, the location was idea right next to broadway street and 5 min from history musuem and central park :). There is a dinner ten walk that was very nice and cheap. I would recommend this hotel and cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Promising Facade, But...”
Reviews.Author: chip37
Reviews.Content: Location is the major plus, given its proximity to the Museum of Natural History, Central Park, and some decent restaurants. Street scene is clean. Facade is imposing and promising. Lobby is small and with nothing distinguishing. The personality of the desk staff is variable, ranging from helpful to impersonal. We had a first floor room just off the Lobby. The hall shows definite signs of wear and need of a good paint job and informed decoration. The room, one of their "larger" was small and rather tastlessly decorated. As noted by others, the bathroom was small, recently re-done, clean and adequate. In final analysis, OK/mediocre given NYC prices. The search continues...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingBard
Reviews.Content: This quiet hotel is in a great location! Walking distance to the Met, Natural History Museum, and Central Park. A multitude of good restaurants within a quick walk. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and well appointed. While it may be considered small - especially the tiny shower - it was more than adequate for a "home base" during our stay in NYC. I would certainly stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend vacation stay - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Cedomir38
Reviews.Content: Pros: great location, excellent value for NYC, friendly staff, overall nice property, well maintained, clean, and quiet - we didn't hear any neighbors. Cons: not anything significant. Bed is fairly hard...could be upgraded, and need at least one accessible outlet that isn't in the bathroom. Overall great room, we would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Average and not worth returning to”
Reviews.Author: maui50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights as a conference I was attending had a deal with the hotel. The hotel was a reasonable price due to this deal but as part of my feedback to the conference organisers, I will be telling them to not bother with this hotel next year. Location: Excellent. 2 blocks from Central Park, in a quiet neighbourhood with good public transport options nearby - two bus routes to downtown and subway stations within a couple of blocks as well. I think I'd like to stay in this area again. Staff: competent but surly. Not quite the American stereotype of 'have a nice day' customer service. Polite, helpful but not friendly. Room: awfully small. Faded in every respect - faded carpets, faded furniture. Very basic in every respect. Handy to have air conditioning but unlike another reviewer, I would not agree that it was sufficient to keep the room cold. Bathroom was absolutely tiny but good pressure in the shower. Personal touches: They'd left some chocolates in the room for me on arrival, which was a nice touch. It's about the only personal touch I got in several days. Yes the wifi is free but this is hardly unique in this day and age! I would not stay at this hotel again but would definitely stay in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Betsyat240
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and were extremely pleased with this hotel. Other reviews talk about small rooms and smaller bathrooms and that was the case but it's New York and to be expected. The in-room bathroom was VERY small but as my dad says, we're not buying the place just staying for a little while so it's fine. The front desk staff and doormen were exceptional. I don't think I ever opened the door for myself and was always greeted. It's such a nice touch. The hotel stored our luggage free of charge the day we were leaving so we could see a few more things before heading to the airport. That was a lovely perk as I've stayed in other hotels in NYC where that has been charged. We enjoyed the location of the hotel being in a residential area where we could sit on the front steps and enjoy the end of the night, chatting with neighbors walking dogs, etc. However having said that, we could see the back of the Natural History Museum from the hotel and Central Park is just a block away so it's not as though the hotel is long distances from popular attractions. Would stay here again in an instant and will recommend it to others as the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “"A little gem on the Upper West Side"”
Reviews.Author: Carol23Maryland
Reviews.Content: With family on the Upper West Side, we have been on the look out for smaller, more reasonable yet charming hotels. We found a real gem. Park 79 is a lovely boutique style hotel with surprisingly upscale accomodations. Our room was sunny, clean, larger than most hotel rooms in NY and boasts a small but contemporary bathroom. The king bed was so comfortable with crisp white cotton bed linens. It's the perfect place for a weekend in NY, well situated off of Central Park West and the History Museum with lots of cute eateries and shops in the area. The front desk staff were friendly and accomodating. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely take advantage of the hotel and especially the great promotional deals in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: afolkertsma
Reviews.Content: We really love this hotel in the Upper West Side of NYC. When we got to the hotel, we were pleased to here we got a free upgrade to a deluxe room on the first floor. What a nice room it was! (room 116) The room is spacious, has nice furniture and lcd tv with a lot of channels. The bed is very nice. The bathroom is a little small, but quite new. There was a smell of benzine in the bathroom, but after the first day it was all gone. The room is quiet, so you really have a good sleep here! Personel is very friendly and helpfull. Location is perfect! Close to the subway, very nice restaurants, central park and museums. Unfortunately there is no breakfast, but you will find enough places in NYC to have your breakfast. If I come back to NYC, i will definitly go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Meh: a shabby room for too much money”
Reviews.Author: Frankbrit
Reviews.Content: We didn't mind the tiny room or the fact that the bathroom was as wide as the toilet. But, it's a shabby place, really, and for more than $250 a night it is not worth it. There were problems with hot water, with the free internet, and with Manhattan's slowest elevator. The service people are nice, for the most part, though the clerk who snapped at me for asking for a receipt at checkout might want to cut down on her coffee. We love the UWS but we were priced out of the Excelsior, the Lucerne, and On The Ave. We thought this place might be a reasonable alternative but it's not.

Reviews.Title: “Little but Lovely”
Reviews.Author: EditorEGR
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location right near Central Park and great restaurants. Easy walk to subway and to American Museum of Natural History. Rooms are small, but clean. Comfortable bed. Nice flat screen TV. Bathroom was tiniest I've ever seen, but nicely appointed. Staff were helpful and gracious. A really great little hotel at a great price. And much quieter than other reviews led me to believe. From Room 201, I heard the elevator and voices once. That was it for a two-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service. Cigarette smoke and too hot.”
Reviews.Author: BallyvaughnGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park79 because I didn't want to spend a fortune to say in Manhattan. The girl at the front desk could not have been more helpful and nice. The bed was extremely comfortable and the sheets smelled so fresh! It was fine that we had a shared bathroom. No big deal. There are two on each floor. You have a sink in your room so you only use the bathroom for the showers and toilets. My only complaint was that the hallways reeked of smoke. Our room was so hot that even though we had the heat turned off in it, the window open, it was snowing outside, we still had to sleep on top of the comforter. The window only opens about 2 inches, so their wasn't any fresh air to let in. It was so hot I tossed and turned all night. They held our luggage so we could go over to the Museum of Natural History which was a 5 min walk away. The deli across the street had great sandwiches. Would stay there again if I was guaranteed a room that wasn't roasting. The walls are paper thin, you could hear everything from the room next door. The sounds of the city are to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: grumpynb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in late March. I was apprehensive but it turned out to be just fine. Yes, the room was very small, the bathroom, the smallest I have ever seen in my life. But everything was very clean and comfortable. The staff was extremely polite and helpful too. I worried about the noise and the thin walls that some reviewers commented on but I was lucky to be in a room that did not directly share a wall with another room. I did hear some noise from guests going up and down in the hallways, talking loudly, but that's unavoidable in a small hotel like this one. Perhaps they can remind guests to be more considerate in the hallways? Anyways, I was only there to sleep really. As a former Upper West Side resident, the location is what sold the hotel to me. It's close to everything, yet not in the middle of tourist attractions. If you like to spend a lot of time in the hotel room while traveling, perhaps this hotel is not for you. But if you want to sleep in a clean, comfortable, safe place and not worry about your belongings while you're out, without paying a fortune, it's just right.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but good”
Reviews.Author: Amys_husband
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a deluxe room with a king bed on the 5th floor. The room was on the smallish size but since we weren't planning on spending much time in the room, it didn't matter. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The only issue was the noise. Hard wood floors in the rooms and hallways make it sound like Secretariat was clomping by everytime someone passed the door. The walls are very thin and you can hear conversations in the next room pretty clearly. The heat is provided by a radiator, so everytime it kicks on you hear pinging for about 10 minutes. None of these were deal breakers though. I liked the neighborhood and all of the restaurants. The location is right by the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. There are two subway entrances within a short walk. At $119 plus taxes per night, I'd stay here again. One suggestion, bring your own shampoo. They stuff they prove is awful. At least that's what the wife says.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, right price but very thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Agathafan14526
Reviews.Content: My daughter (11) and I stayed 4 nights in march 2011. Location was a definite plus. Price a double plus. My only complaint was we could hear our neighbors music and laughing as if they were in our own room. Very annoying. But overall it was perfect for our needs, a bed to sleep and a private bath. Staff was also very friendly and accommadating.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Priced Right - Definitely No Frills”
Reviews.Author: Broodmoor
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed 3 nights at the Park 79 over February vacation. It was well-located for our plans to visit the American Natural History Museum and Central Park. Only 1 block from Subway Train 1 into Times Square or the Statue of Liberty. The quiet residential neighborhood felt safe and friendly. The hotel definitely has the feel of a hostel. We had a comfortable bed in a very small but clean room, our own bathroom with shower stall, and a nice TV. The staff are friendly and there's coffee in the lobby each morning but not much else for amenities. The drawbacks are the thin walls and old, small, squeaky elevator. Getting to sleep was tough some nights when our neighbors came and went at late hours or had calls to make. We could hear every word from the rooms across the hallway. All in all; it was inexpensive (NYC-wise) and adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: What a great little boutique hotel! And such a deal for this neighborhood and this city. This little hotel looks unassuming both from their website and from the outside. Hard to tell it's a hotel and not just another apartment on 79th. The lobby was tiny but well cared for. The whole place felt like a prewar apartment building with it's high ceilings, elaborate molding and hardwood floors. The staff was excellent and helpful. Porter showed me to my room and brought my bag up. Maids were helpful. The room was tiny, by North American standards, but perfectly fine for one person. I would have booked a deluxe if I was sharing. Nice comfy modern bed with great duvet and soft sheets. Bathroom was closet sized but looked brand new and clean. Nice toiletries. Flat screen mounted television with plenty of channels. Air conditioner worked like a charm. Laptop sized safe, ironing board and free wireless, yes free wireless in Manhattan. And it was pretty fast too. Location couldn't be beat. Easy to get to anything you fancy from discount drug stores to upscale restaurants. Only a couple of blocks from the natural history museum and central park. Just an awesome little hotel. You can't beat this deal in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Very thin walls. No privacy at all”
Reviews.Author: mconde77
Reviews.Content: We spend the weekend in NY. The hotel location is perfect. Good restaurants, good transportation, right next to Central Park. The room is very very small but clean. BUT there is no privacy at all. We had to listen a couple next to our room having sex for hours during two days. The couple was a little bit loud, but it wasn't that. The walls are almost inexistent so even if you have a normal conversation, you can hear it outside the room like if the doors were open. It was a very uncomfortable situation having to deal with all the sounds pre sex, during sex and after sex of this couple. It felt like we were in a cheap motel in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “hotel but not for families”
Reviews.Author: FrancyG72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean even if a bit old. It it conveniently located near the Museum of Natural History. The area (Upper West Side) is quite good to be. I would advice the hotel for couples not for families with children though. The room (and the bathroom) are way too small to allow a family a comfortable stay. Plus there is practically no hall nor breakfast room, nor common areas where you can be with children, leave aside amenities to entertain children, like swimming pool. It is also not recomandable if you are there for business according to me. But if you are a young couple on a leisure travel to New York (that does not plan to be too much in the room) this might be the hotel for you. One last advice: do not leave your luggage in deposit! They mistakenly gave our luggage to another customer and we could get it back only because this person was so nice as to call us and arrange to meet...

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad! Did the job”
Reviews.Author: TransitingGemini
Reviews.Content: Need a place in NYC with good location.. not interested in the frills of a luxury hotel.. a place to crash after a long day! park 79 is just the place. I agree with most reviews that the rooms are tiny, but the double bed was big enough and the staff were excellent with their cleaning. We had a pvt bathroom which was small but clean. Would not recommend it if you are planning to stay indoors for a long time. but with so much to do and see in NYC i doubt anyone will have the time stay indoors for long other than to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best.”
Reviews.Author: johnnlisa
Reviews.Content: As always, checked TA to select the hotel. Reviews were just about what I'd write, but I'd go a half-step lower. Location is great. Hotel staff is awesome: Front door help was always there, problems with the room were addressed immediately, and maid service did an excellent job of keeping the room clean. However, room was TINY (Deluxe room...i.e. private bath), walls were thin, first sheets were stained (washed, but still stained), towels were ripped, heat was noisy and no hot H20 when everyone else in hotel was showering at same time. It's an OK place. Average, at best . Fine if you are OK with a tiny (and I mean tiny, even for NYC standards) room and average accomodations. It's suitable for someone who does not plan to spend too much time in the room and is not looking for anything more than a basic and clean room. I'd be happy to pay another $25 for the same room a bit better appointed (no ripped towels), some carpets in the hall to absorb foot traffic (tough to not be awakened at night when the person with the shared bath is going across the hardwood hall to the bathroom) and a faster elevator (significantly faster to walk four stories). Conversely, if the room was $25 less, then the price/accomodations would be in sync. For specific reference to the questions below, I would recommend this hotel to a friend only if they were severely budgeted in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than an expensive hostel!.”
Reviews.Author: paul_r_buttigieg
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this "hotel". It is nothing comparable to a hostel. They do not tell you that they offer semi-private rooms....share bathrooms in the hallway. The rooms are tiny, dirty, smelly, no air conditioning, no sound proofing and they cater to backpackers. The prices are not cheap either. For about the same money you can stay at a REAL HOTEL in midtown. STAY AWAY from the Park 79 Hotel. You will glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, excellent facility, most gracious management help ever!”
Reviews.Author: BarbBD
Reviews.Content: Clean; small but just what we needed; and location, location, location -- the best for us. Most significantly, there were last minute changes beyond our control before our trip had even started, and management's help after we got to the hotel (don't you usually feel trapped at that point?!) was the most gracious we've ever encountered in New York!!! Unqualified thanks you from us. This is definitely where we will try to get our next room in New York --and we hope it can be soon. We've already told all of our friends and neighbors...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, GREAT staff, NO BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: sopchoppymommy72
Reviews.Content: Very happy to report that, after searching for a "bug-free" hotel, we found one in the middle of this yucky epidemic! Park 79 has the friendliest and most polite staff I have ever encountered on my MANY trips and stays in New York! Awesome location - 1 block to the 1 train on Broadway, 2 short blocks to the C train on 81st. BEautiful, quiet Upper West Side location gives you a true feel fo9r being a New Yorker! Safe, pleasant neighborhood, and a doorman 24/7 help you with anything you may need! We were fortunate to get an upgrade to a room with a private bath, on the first floor! Small, but clean and VERY comfy bed with duvet! SMALL bathroom, but hey! How muich time do you ACTUALLY spend in your room in NYC? This will be my hotel of choice on ALL my future trips and a strong recommendation to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “A more accurate Review...”
Reviews.Author: thebrewer1981
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by saying that i am a 29yr old male being accompanied by a 29 yr old female architect. I must say that both of us were pleasantly suprised by the hotel after reading the mixed reviews online. So i wanted to take the time to right an honest review of the place so that like minded travelers will share the same experience my friend and i had. The Park 79 Hotel located in West Manhatten inbetween mid town and up town is an old building, but renovated to a more modern style. The location is only a block away from the Metro and only two blocks from a bar and fantastic coffee house. I like many others hopped on trip advisor and other travel review sites and discovered that the hotel was rated only 3 stars. I read several good reviews and several bad reviews of the place. Being my first time in New York City i was really concerned with finding a safe area and the few bad reviews i had read about park 79 was enough to make me nervous upon arrival. Well within the first 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel all of my worries were sent sailing. The Hotel staff was extremely courtious. ( I never opened the lobby door once! ) the room yet small was perfectly clean with a nice flat screen television and a very modern black tiled bathroom and shower. My friend and I shared a single bed and we did not have any problems at all sleeping. We paid roughly 150$ per night during the week and for Manhatten prices for a hotel with a private bathroom im not sure it can be beat. Ok so obviously im a fan of this hotel and would definetly stay there again. The only reason i will not give it 5 stars is because the elevator in the building is old and it does a take a while to reach the 7th floor and also the walls are thin and you can hear your neighbor pretty easily, but rarely did it bother me. But like i said im not the type of person who freaks out if my pillow is not fluffed correctly... or if the door guy doesnt completely kiss my butt everytime i walk in the door... So i would like to tell all of the travelers out there.. That you honestly can not go wrong with this hotel and it's very close location to the metro line. I talked to a groupd of travelers staying in a hostel in brooklyn for only 20$ cheaper than this place in manhatten with a private bath! And for those who rated this hotel in a negative way may i suggest quit being so nit picky and scaring off potential travelers just because the hotel is not as fancy as there $250,000 garden home. Im glad i took a chance on this hotel and would certaintly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: machocomacho
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of hotels in New York over the years and have never had a bad experience at any of them and this hotel is no exception. I stayed for a couple of nights with my 6 year old daughter recently and found the room clean, well appointed, quiet and very comfortable. The staff were welcoming and helpful and given it was much less expensive than the average hotel, I really didn't expect it to be so nice. The location is great - away from the tourist madness of Times Square and situated only a short distance from the downtown subway in one direction and Central Park and the Natural History Museum in the other. You're in amongst the local residents making their way to work and school and walking the dogs... There aren't a lot of extras like spa, pool, gym and room service, but that's not what I was there for. I experience the great restaurants and work off the calories by walking around the city - basically use the hotel for sleep, shower and to store the luggage - little else in such a fantastic city with so much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: litco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as described but when reservations were made, there was no mention of a shared bathroom. I found out before we got there by calling about something else and asking. Not much of a problem and it appeared clean. The room was small but we knew to expect that, but it was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Yes, the elevator was slow but we managed to take the stairs to the fourth floor most of the time (exercise!). The walls must be thin so it is a bit noisy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although parking is promised, we had to go to 3 parking lots associated with the hotel (which were full) and finally got them to find us one but was $55/day plus $12/day extra for oversize (Yukon). The other lots were $30/day. The location is great and there is a little Amsterdam Deli on the corner of 79th and Amsterdam that was perfect for us. The subway is close and very easy to get to Time Square -first time users and we felt very safe. Nice residential neighbourhood. I suggest taking the Gray Line Hop on Hop off bus tour. Great way to get around and see the sights with informative guides. For shopping, I suggest Canal Street for purses and pashminas and we had good luck with Macy's and K-Mart, both on 34th Street. Would love to go back ...not enough time to explore Central Park and Rockefeller Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood and Value”
Reviews.Author: UNCtraveler08
Reviews.Content: We were in New York for a wedding and thought it would be a great idea to extend our trip by a little bit and do some sight seeing. This hotel was in a great location it was quiet, felt very safe, and was in the middle of everything. The staff was nice and we were able to leave our luggage with the front desk since check out was at 11am and our flight didn't leave until 6pm. It was very close to central park and several subway stops. Wonderful hotel, an exception value for NYC. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, no air, bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Jesstravel
Reviews.Content: Don't go here. I stayed here for a week. I would have changed but there were no other hotels available at such short notice in a reasonable price range...so I was stuck with this hotel. The elevator is s-l-o-w, so add 10 minutes travel time everytime you leave your room. Secondly, the air-conditioner was very noisy, barely worked - when I called to ask about it, they said I had to press very hard (didn't work) or bang the machine a bit for it to change settings. The window that could open and from which you could look outside was in the bathroom, rest is all done with artificial lighting. Last but not least, there was barely any water and it wasn't hot. When I called about that they said they sent someone up - but they didn't. Lying staff really makes for a pleasant stay. Then I asked to be refunded that night and they said that wasn't possible as I prepaid. When I replied that my bank had assured me I could cancel the entire payment for the whole week without a second thought and that I would cancel for all nights if they didn't see fit to refund me that one night, all of a sudden it was possible to refund that night. The free internet they advertise is incredibly slow...not worth it. Never-ever again and I really wouldn't recommend it to anyone, not even if they're desperate.

Reviews.Title: “PARK 79”
Reviews.Author: draviol
Reviews.Content: Great location... 1st time in New York. We were thrilled at how close this charming hotel was to all, including central park, great restaurants, subway, bus, taxis train all....we enjoyed the quiet, small hotel in a great neighborhood...lots of great restuarnats near by Isabellas was fantastic...we have a friend staying there next week.

Reviews.Title: “Don't plan on getting a good nights rest here.”
Reviews.Author: Deepray
Reviews.Content: Hotel was on the boutique side and the rooms were small but functional. The problem is that the mattresses were the most uncomfortable I have ever slept on. It was like sleeping on a concrete slab. I woke up in the morning feeling so tired and my back was not in good shape. I normally like a firm mattress but these are rock hard. You get what you pay for and I will be spending a little more next time so I can sleep. Never had this problem before at any other hotel ever. They also told me there was a gym and surprise surprise there isnt one.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bopperbee
Reviews.Content: Yes...Would have given good reviews if we had not been treated so poorly even before we got there. To give our reserved room away to someone else just because they asked is truly wrong in my book. Who gives the option to make a reservation but gives it away? We had arrived in NYC too late (given that we made plans and we were starving after just flying in) to just turn around and refuse the smaller bedroom. The double bed was wide enough but too short for a tall person. I am only happy that I was able to shower and get some sleep in the room they gave us. The elevator takes long enough to the point that you hate elevator music if you don't already. On the up side, I imagine the place is as cutely small as the standard NY hotel should be. The deluxe room, is probably great for just one person. Being a light sleeper, I did notice a lot of noises next door and down the hallway. It's hard to tell that the bathroom is not that clean because its tiles are black-gray. It looks nice, although I don't think they keep it very clean. Like I said, I probably would've slept better and been happy if I was in the room that I signed up for.

Reviews.Title: “Failure from the Top Down”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller9000
Reviews.Content: What's the one thing you expect from a hotel? The one thing above all that matters more than anything else? That's right, honoring your reservation. This hotel had my reservation, and chose not to honor it. They didn't lose it, they didn't make a mistake, someone consciously made the decision not to honor it. I had a deluxe room reserved for the Friday night I flew into NYC, but they chose to let someone who had been there during the week extend their stay. As a result, I was downgraded. I was traveling with my girlfriend, and the smaller room did not have the queen bed the deluxe did -- which was the whole reason to book it in the first place. To top it off, they charged me full price for the smaller room! Booking a hotel should _NOT_ be like renting a car. We've come to expect horrible service from car rental companies, this place is taking the hotel standard to a new low. What I think happened is that I booked a promotional rate through their website (that's right, not even through a third party site), and this 'other person' was booked at full price. So they decided to let the person paying full price extend their stay over my reservation. Other than that, rooms were clean but super super tiny (an overweight person might struggle to sit on the toilet as the walls are about as narrow as the back of it). Location was decent. Elevator was terrible -- if you have luggage, request a room on the lower levels. Rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “My third stay here; will return...”
Reviews.Author: bjrWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park 79 Hotel in Manhattan August 29th through September 2nd. The hotel's location is the best selling point for me.
